p:introduction.p: M2E provides both a framework for building Maven-centric Eclipse tools and set of tools and user interface elements directly consumable by Eclipse Users.

div.p: As a framework, M2E provides facilities to import and configure Maven projects in Eclipse workspace as well as APIs that allow m2e extensions to access Maven project metadata and participate in Maven project configuration and workspace build.

p:introduction.div:
For the end user, M2E provides:
wizards to import existing and to create new Maven projects
rich form-based and text-based pom.xml file editor
launch configuration type to launch Maven build directly from Eclipse IDE
access Maven repository index to browse repository contents and in various code-assist
p:introduction.p: Extensible JDT integration is provided by M2E as well.

p:target_environments.p: M2E requires minimum Java SE 5 VM.

M2E is compatible with Eclipse 3.5.2, Eclipse 3.6.2 and Eclipse 3.7 and is generally expected to work on each of these Eclipse releases respective referenced platforms with additional requirement of Java SE 5 or better VM.

p:internationalization.p: All m2e user interface elements are externalized, but only English strings are provided as the default resource bundles.

p:compatibility_with_previous_releases.h3: Compatibility with Sonatype m2eclipse 0.10.x and earlier m2eclipse releases
p:compatibility_with_previous_releases.p: API Contract Compatibility: To comply with Eclipse Foundation requirements, all m2e java package and extension points have been moved to org.eclipse.m2e namespace. No compatibility layer will be provided for consumers of earlier versions of m2eclipse.

Workspace Compatibility: No migration will be provided for workspaces created with earlier versions of m2eclipse. Sharing of the same workspace with m2e 0.13.0 and earlier versions of m2eclipse will not be supported. The users are expected to start with new workspace and import their projects using "Existing Maven Projects" import wizards.

ul.li: Metadata driven lifecycle mapping. M2E will define lifecycle mapping metadata format and mechanisms to embed mapping metadata in project pom.xml files, share mapping metadata among multiple related projects and provide mapping metadata via Eclipse extension point.

p:committed.ul: Find and install required extension. M2E will only support limited number of standard Maven plugins out of the box, while support for other Maven plugins is expected to be provided by thirdparty extension. M2E will provide discovery mechanism that will help users find and install extensions required to support their projects.

ul.li: Include latest released Maven version Maven is an active opensource project with new release produced at roughly six weeks intervals. To maintain parity with bugfixes and new features available to command line Maven users, m2e will include latest Maven version available in time for Ingigo release. We will work with Maven core developers to align m2e and maven release schedules.
